chapter.title: Exercise: Adding data and specifying contracts

section.title: Goal
section.para: The goal of this exercise is to continue the leave request process implementation by:

listitem.para: setting up a Business Data Model (BDM)
specifying contracts for the case instantiation and human tasks

section.para: Once completed, the process will be executable with automatically generated forms.

warning.para: It is mandatory to strictly observe the case and syntax of the technical names provided in the instructions. Failing to do so will result in errors.

section.title: Instructions overview
section.para: Duplicate the process diagram from the previous exercise to create a 2.0.0 version.
Create a "LeaveRequest" BDM with the following attributes (don't use the "Multiple" option):
Declare a business variable "request" of type "LeaveRequest" on your pool.
Using the Studio assistant (i.e.: "Add from data..."), generate the case instantiation contract, as well as the initialization script, from the "request" data with the following mandatory items:

listitem.para: leaveStart
dayCount

section.para: Add these two constraints on the case instantiation contract:

listitem.para: "leaveStart" must be in the future
"dayCount" must be strictly greater than zero

section.para: Add a step contract on the "Validate request" task use the Studio assistant with the following item:

listitem.para: isApproved

para.emphasis: Duplicate the process diagram from the previous exercise to create a 2.0.0 version.

listitem.para: In the Studio's top menu, click on "File / Duplicate diagram...".
Update the process diagram AND pool version numbers.
Navigate to the "Development / Business Data Model / Define..." top menu.
Click on "Add" (A) in the "List of Business Objects" and name the object "LeaveRequest" (B) (this is a technical name so it should not contain spaces or special characters).
With the "LeaveRequest" object selected, add the following attributes (C):
Click on "Finish".
You should be displayed with the following message that confirm the deployment of the BDM. Check the box "Don't show me this message again" and click on "Ok".

para.emphasis: Declare an instance of the "LeaveRequest" BDM on your process

listitem.para: Select the process pool, and navigate to the "Data / Pool variables" tab.
In the "Business variables" section, click on "Add...".
Name the variable "request" and select the "LeaveRequest" business object.
Click on "Finish".

para.emphasis: Set up the case instantiation contract

listitem.para: Select the process pool, and navigate to the "Execution / Contract / Inputs" tab.
Click on "Add from data...".
Select the "request" business data, keep the default input name "requestInput" and click on "Next".
Uncheck the "requestorId" and "isApproved" attributes.
Click on "Finish" (not on "Finish & Add") and dismiss the warning message about the incomplete initialization of the business variable.
Still in the "Execution / Contract" tab, switch to the "Constraints" tab.
Add the following constraint:

row.entry: Leave start must be in the future

listitem.para: Add a second constraint:

row.entry: Day count must be greater than zero

listitem.para: Select the process pool, and navigate to the "Data / Pool variables" tab.
Select the "request" business variable and click on "Edit...".
Click on the "Pencil" icon next to the "Default value" field to open the expression editor.
Clear all of the generated code and replace it by the following:
This will initialize the BDM from the contract data and set the process initiator as the request author.
Click on "OK" button to close the expression editor.
Click again on "OK" button to confirm the modification of the business data.

para.emphasis: Set up the "Validate request" step contract

listitem.para: Select the "Validate request" task and navigate to the "Execution / Contract / Inputs" tab.
Click on "Add from data..."
Select the "request" business data, keep the default input name "requestInput" and click on "Next".
Check only the "isApproved" attribute.
Click on "Finish" (not on "Finish & Add") and dismiss the warning message about the incomplete initialization of the business variable.

para.emphasis: Note that an operation on "Validate request" to update the request has been automatically generated:

listitem.para: With the "Validate request" task selected, navigate to the "Execution / Operations" tab.

para.emphasis: Use the business data to dynamically control the process flow

listitem.para: Select the transition "Yes" and navigate to the "General / General" tab.
Click on the pencil icon next to the "Condition" drop-down to open the expression editor.
In the expression editor, select "Java" as the expression type, select the "request" variable and the "isApproved" method.
Click on the "Save" button from the Studio's top menu bar.

para.emphasis: Run the process to test your contract constraints.

listitem.para: Run the process and use the automatically generated forms to test your constraints.
for the "leaveStart" input, enter a date in the YYYY-MM-DD format.
for the "isApproved" input, enter a boolean value: either "true" or "false".
